decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan by playing hatebears that restrict their options and slow down their strategy. By combining aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Anointed Peacekeeper with disruptive elements like Chancellor of the Annex and Void Mirror, the deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's ability to play their spells effectively. The deck also includes mana acceleration and card advantage engines to ensure a consistent stream of threats and disruption throughout the game.

The main goal of this deck is to utilize the graveyard as a powerful resource, constantly filling it with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to dig through the deck quickly, the player can quickly assemble a powerful board presence of creatures like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam. The deck also includes disruption aspects with cards like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to protect the combo pieces. Overall, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced and resilient combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck includes disruptive cards like Collector Ouphe, Force of Will, and Abrupt Decay to slow down the opponent, while also utilizing aggressive threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Deathrite Shaman to quickly close out the game. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's resources, while also maintaining a strong board presence with efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful artifacts and disruptive cards to rapidly build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and resource denial. Mishra's Workshop and other mana acceleration cards allow for quick deployment of threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem, while cards like Chalice of the Void and Sphere of Resistance disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge for additional utility and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and secure a swift victory.

The primary strategy of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker and Psychic Frog. The deck aims to control the game through efficient use of resources, including powerful spells like Force of Will and Ancestral Recall. By utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble to generate card advantage and mana acceleration, the player can outvalue their opponent and grind out a victory through incremental advantages.

The focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy using counterspells and removal spells. It also aims to generate card advantage through card draw and tutoring effects. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to recur low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck utilizes powerful Vintage staples such as Ancestral Recall, Black Lotus, and Force of Will to establish dominance and outmaneuver the opponent while gradually wearing them down with efficient threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog.

This deck aims to control the game by using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play, such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also includes a variety of counterspells and disruption, along with card advantage cards like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm. The deck can quickly ramp up with mana acceleration from cards like Black Lotus and Moxen, while also utilizing cards like Show and Tell to put pressure on the opponent. Overall, the key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful threats to take control of the game.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana and drawing cards quickly to set up a powerful combo utilizing Paradoxical Outcome. The deck includes mana acceleration with Moxen and rituals, card draw and filtering with Merchant Scroll and Ancestral Recall, and ways to protect the combo with Force of Will and Flusterstorm. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as an additional resource for the deck, providing recursion and flexibility. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to generate a large storm count and win the game with Brain Freeze or other win conditions.

The key strategy of this deck is to control and manipulate the game by using a combination of powerful spells and artifacts. By leveraging cards like Force of Will, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Karn, the Great Creator, the player can disrupt their opponent's plans and establish board control. Cards like Ancestral Recall, Demonic Tutor, and Tinker allow the player to quickly search for and play key cards. The deck also includes mana acceleration with Moxen and other artifact ramp, enabling the player to cast impactful spells ahead of schedule.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage while utilizing powerful one-drop creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a dominant board presence through cards like Sword to Plowshares and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade. The inclusion of a companion like Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value and synergy with the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control of the game and outlasting the opponent's threats to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on using counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption to control the game while utilizing card advantage with spells like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides a recurring threat to keep pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes mana acceleration cards like Mox Sapphire and Black Lotus to help cast powerful spells ahead of curve. With a mix of disruptive spells, efficient threats, and card advantage engines, this Dimir Control deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent in a 1 vs 1 Vintage format.

The deck focuses on utilizing hatebear creatures and disruptive spells to slow down opponent's strategies while maintaining a fast aggro gameplay. By using cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to tax opponent's spells, alongside powerful threats like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer, the deck aims to pressure opponents while disrupting their game plan. The inclusion of cards like Void Mirror and Anointed Peacekeeper further hinders opponent's strategies, making it difficult for them to effectively cast spells and stabilize against the aggressive assault of the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and disruptive creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and controlling the board. It aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through card advantage, counterspells, and disruption. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value over the course of the game. By leveraging powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Sword to Plowshares, along with disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, the deck aims to grind out victories through careful resource management and efficient plays.

The core strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the Coveted Jewel combo using mana acceleration and card draw. The key cards like Mishra's Workshop, Mana Crypt, and Paradoxical Outcome help generate the necessary resources to play the Jewel and activate its ability for maximum advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to protect the combo and control the opponent's plays. Overall, this deck aims to efficiently set up and execute its win condition through careful sequencing and resource management.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids as a powerful control tool, allowing the player to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Oko, Thief of Crowns early in the game. The deck also includes various counter spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect against opposing threats, along with additional disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Strip Mine. The deck aims to quickly establish board control and outvalue the opponent through its powerful creatures and disruptive elements.

The focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's board through a mix of counterspells, removal, and control elements such as Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Fatal Push. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise to maintain hand advantage. Additionally, utilizing powerful cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion and disruptive creatures like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters, the deck aims to outvalue and out-control the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on a combination of Oath of Druids and Show and Tell to cheat powerful creatures into play. It includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to control the board and gain advantage. Additionally, there are mana acceleration cards like Black Lotus and Sol Ring to ramp up quickly and disrupt opponents with cards like Null Rod. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while setting up game-winning combos with Oath of Druids.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, then utilize cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam to drain the opponent's life total. The deck also focuses on using the Dredge mechanic with cards like Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp to constantly recur key creatures like Narcomoeba and Ichorid. With the ability to disrupt the opponent with cards like Force of Will and Grief, this combo-focused deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of graveyard recursion and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on assembling the Coveted Jewel combo using cards like Mishra's Workshop, Tolarian Academy, and Grim Monolith to generate mana quickly. The key cards like Coveted Jewel, Time Vault, and Paradoxical Outcome are used to create a powerful synergy that allows the player to draw cards, untap artifacts, and gain control of the game. Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional support and recursion. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to protect the combo and control the opponent's plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plays while also generating card advantage with cards like Dig Through Time and Ancestral Recall. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for recurring of key cards from the graveyard, adding consistency and resilience to the deck's game plan.

This control Dimir deck focuses on disruption, removal, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes various counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, along with removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also includes card draw and selection tools such as Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, control the board, and ultimately win the game through card advantage and efficient plays.

The main focus of this deck is to use Oath of Druids as a powerful control tool to summon powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes a variety of counterspells and removal spells to control the game and protect the player's creatures. Additionally, there are cards like Show and Tell and Flash to cheat creatures into play and gain a strategic advantage. Overall, the deck aims to dominate the battlefield and outmaneuver the opponent by utilizing various powerful cards and strategic plays.

The key concept of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Dredge deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then abuse cards like Creeping Chill, Silversmote Ghoul, and Prized Amalgam to quickly drain the opponent's life total. The deck utilizes cards like Bazaar of Baghdad to quickly dump cards into the graveyard, while also including disruption like Force of Will and Grief to protect its combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats from the graveyard while also disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on assembling a fast and aggressive board presence with powerful artifacts and utilizing cards like Urza's Saga, Mishra's Workshop, and Talon Gates of Madara to generate mana quickly. The deck also includes ways to untap artifacts multiple times, such as Manifold Key and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, to take advantage of powerful artifacts like Walking Ballista and Mystic Forge. With strong artifacts like The One Ring and artifacts-matter cards like Karn, the Great Creator, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient and explosive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria to slow down the opponent's spells and abilities, combined with hate cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Void Mirror, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and limit the opponent's options. The deck also includes mana acceleration with artifacts like Chrome Mox and Moxen to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by utilizing counterspells, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, and land destruction cards like Wasteland. It also includes card advantage generators like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for consistent card advantage and recursion of key cards. The deck's win condition is to control the game until it can deploy a threat, such as a creature like Lavinia or a disruptive spell like Psychic Frog, to seal the victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells and efficient removal to control the game while leveraging powerful draw spells and card advantage engines. It also includes key combo pieces like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Stock Up to grind out advantages over opponents. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, protect its own threats, and ultimately outvalue opponents with its versatile card selection and manipulation. The inclusion of powerful Vintage restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk also provides additional ways to gain advantage and close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's plans with hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper and Chancellor of the Annex, while also limiting their resources with cards like Archon of Emeria and Void Mirror. The goal is to slow down your opponent's game plan and apply pressure with creatures like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration with cards like Black Lotus and the Mox cycle, allowing you to quickly establish a board presence and close out games efficiently.

This deck utilizes the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill the board with powerful creatures like Hollow One and Prized Amalgam. By discarding cards and using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Stinkweed Imp, the deck can quickly dredge through the deck, triggering powerful effects and overwhelming opponents. It also includes disruption like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap to protect the combo from opposing strategies. The goal is to quickly assemble a board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on creating a disruptive board state by utilizing artifact-based aggro cards and mana acceleration to overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy involves using Mishra's Workshop to deploy powerful artifacts like Wasteland, Sphere of Resistance, and Trinisphere to slow down the opponent's game plan. Additional cards like Crucible of Worlds and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim provide utility and card advantage to maintain pressure. The deck aims to quickly establish control through mana denial and lockout effects, ultimately outpacing the opponent with efficient threats and disruptive plays.

This deck aims to generate mana quickly and efficiently, using artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen to power out powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo pieces. The key strategy is to utilize cards that can draw into crucial combo pieces while also controlling the board. By efficiently managing resources and setting up the combo, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various counter spells and disruption while also utilizing the powerful combo potential of Gifts Ungiven and Underworld Breach. By effectively managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the player aims to outmaneuver their opponent and secure victory through card advantage and strategic plays. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion offers additional value by allowing for recurring cards from the graveyard, further strengthening the control aspect of the deck.
